To explain it simple.

The update thing have nothing to do with fm. New games require latest dashboard.
I already have a current nxe dashboard, Ill try to update anyway...

I GOT IT TO WORK!

Here is the solution for the infinite update restart problem (at least it works for me):

1. first off, if you do not have the latest nxe update, than upfate it manualy via USB, like someone before me said:
you get it here:
http://digiex.net/downloads/download-center-2-0/xbox-360-content/dashboard-updates/2747-nxe-update-2-0-8955-0-avatars-download.html

2. I already had the latest NXE (november 17. 09)on my 360, but it kept on restarting after the game disc update anyway...

2.1 ...so I downloaded the latest NXE anyway, extracted the file on USB, and put it into the USB port on the 360. The 360 was on when i put the usb into it...
2.2 ...what happened next was exactly....nothing. No popup messega to update or something similar...as if i did not connect anything to the 360. 
2.3 so I just hit the A button on the controller (the AO2:TFD disc was already in the console) to play the game, and voila!!! It did not ask me to update the game this time! The game booted normaly and is playable.

After my first successful boot, I disconnected the usb, and the game boots fine anyway. I tried this multiple times now,  turning the 360 off and the game boots normal. This goes for wave3(in case you patched so you don have to put activate.iso each time in) and wave 4 discs. I get no update message whatsoever now, and am able to play the game.
